column2: Job Description of Welder :  Welders shall aware MIG/TIG with minimum 3 to 4 years of experience preferably in Heavy Industries, with ITI and NCVT.  Should have knowledge of all types of welding positions.  Should have knowledge and awareness how to read RT joint film and to rectify the joint in case of any discontinuity.  Should have knowledge and awareness how to rectify the welding defects.  Should have knowledge and awareness of weld defects and their remedial measures.  Sould have knowledge and hand on experience in grinding and fitment of welding job/assembly.  Should have knowledge and hand on experience of cutting flames, also able to handle oxy cutting cutting and heating sets/trollies with all safety measures.  Should have knowledge and awareness of all PPEs to be used in the fabrication shop.  Should have knowledge and awareness on time recording (Direct Hrs. and Indirect Hrs.)  Should be able to read all Engineering drawings, and conversant with all welding symbols.  Should have good knowledge and awareness of WPS.  Should have knowledge and awareness of 5S to keep workstation safe and clean.  Should have good operating knowledge of welding machines MAG/TIG.  Knowledge of EN standard

column2: Looking for challenging roleIf you really want to make adifference - make it with us                 Can we energize societyand fight climate change at the same time             At Siemens Energy, we can.Our technology is key, but our people make the difference. Brilliant mindsinnovate. They connect, create, and keep us on track towards changing theworld s energy systems. Their spirit fuels our mission.              Our culture is defined bycaring, agile, respectful, and accountable individuals. We value excellence ofany kind. Sounds like you                             Your new role - challenging andfuture-         oriented:             You will be the engineering interface with Manufacturing andSupplier quality functions.         You will be applying your knowledge of metallurgy, welding,materials, physics, engineering, and standards for examining, designing, andevaluating welds.         You will plan, supervise, and document welding operations usingrelevant codes, drawings, or contracts.          The role involves review and approval of all welding documentation(WPSs, PQR s and WPQRs) to ensure compliance with Siemens weldingspecification.         As an experienced Welding engineer, you will be interacting withSupplier Qualification and Development team for supplier audit, supplierqualification and for PPQ orders.                     We don t need superheroes, just super minds:                     Bachelors in mechanical engineering or Masters in Engineering withspecialization in Welding Engineering, Material Science, orMetallurgical/Materials Engineering.         3 - 8 years relevant work experience is required.         Ability to accurately interpret manufacturing processes anddrawings/graphics.         Strong initiatives and able to work independently while alsocollaborating closely with colleagues in remote locations.         Clear, concise, and consistent communication skills.         Willing and able to learn from colleagues and demonstrate strongteamwork in support of the global team.              Expertise in common arc welding processes              Shielded Metal Arc Welding (SMAW)         Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW)         Gas Tungsten Arc Welding (GTAW)         Flux-Cored Arc Welding (FCAW)                     Expertise in metallurgical concepts including material behaviorduring welding especially for carbon steel, stainless steel, and alloy steels.          Excellent understanding of welding terminology.         Clear understanding of the welding codes and their application forInternational Organization for Standardization (ISO), American Society ofMechanical Engineers (ASME) Boiler and Pressure Vessel (BPV), and AmericanWelding Society (AWS) Codes.         Development and qualification of welding procedures.     Clear understanding of how to create aProcedure Qualification Record (PQR) and how to qualify a Welding ProcedureSpecification (WPS).         Clear understanding of essential variables and non-essentialvariables including base metal P/group-number, thickness, weld type, productform, filler metal etc.         Rules for qualification of welding personnel.         Clear understanding of welding symbols, both per ISO and per ASME         Experience with welding evaluation         Basic understanding of Nondestructive Examination (NDE) on welds -Able to list common NDE methods and what types of joints are tested witheach.             Certified Welding Inspector (CWI) preferred                             We ve got quite a lot to offer. How about you                   This role is based at Site (Pune ). You ll also get to visit otherlocations in India and beyond, so you ll need to go where this journey takesyou. In return, you ll get the chance to work with teams impacting entirecities, countries - and the shape of things to come.

column2: Micron Systems and Controls Pvt Ltd  is looking for Fabricator  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Interpreting Blueprints: Study and interpret engineering drawings, blueprints, and specifications to understand the design and dimensions of the metal components or structures to be fabricated      Material Preparation: Select the appropriate metal materials and prepare them by cutting, shearing, or sawing them to the required size and shape using specialized machinery and tools      Shaping and Forming: Use techniques such as bending, rolling, and pressing to shape the metal pieces into the desired forms and dimensions      Welding and Joining: Weld or join metal components together using welding techniques, such as MIG (Metal Inert Gas) welding, TIG (Tungsten Inert Gas) welding, or arc welding      Assembly: Assemble fabricated parts or components into larger structures, ensuring proper alignment and adherence to design specifications      Finishing: Apply finishing touches to fabricated products, including grinding, sanding, and polishing, to achieve a smooth and aesthetically pleasing surface finish      Quality Control: Inspect fabricated products for defects, dimensional accuracy, and quality, and make necessary adjustments or repairs as needed      Safety: Adhere to safety protocols and wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) when working with metal fabrication equipment and processes

column2: Overview:  We are seeking a skilled TIG (Tungsten Inert Gas) Welder to join our team. The ideal candidate will have experience in TIG welding and a strong understanding of welding techniques, materials, and safety procedures. This position offers an opportunity to work in a dynamic environment and contribute to the production of high-quality products. Responsibilities: Perform TIG welding on various metals, including stainless steel, aluminum, and titanium, according to project specifications and welding codes. Read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and welding symbols to determine the appropriate welding techniques and parameters. Set up welding equipment, including selecting and installing the correct TIG torch, filler material, and shielding gas. Prepare metal surfaces by cleaning, grinding, and bevelling to ensure proper weld penetration and quality. Monitor welding performance and make adjustments to ensure weld quality and integrity, including controlling heat input and maintaining proper arc length. Inspect welded joints to ensure they meet quality standards and specifications, including visual inspection and non-destructive testing methods. Collaborate with other team members, including engineers and fabricators, to troubleshoot welding issues and optimize production processes. Maintain a clean and organized work area, including proper storage of welding equipment and materials, and adhere to safety guidelines and procedures at all times. Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent; technical training or certification in welding preferred. Proven experience as a TIG welder, with a strong understanding of welding principles and techniques. Proficiency in reading and interpreting blueprints, drawings, and welding symbols. Familiarity with a variety of metals and welding processes, including stainless steel, aluminum, and titanium. Ability to set up and operate TIG welding equipment, including TIG torches, power sources, and gas cylinders. Strong attention to detail and quality, with the ability to produce accurate and consistent welds. Good communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and supervisors. Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment. Knowledge of welding safety practices and procedures, including proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and safe handling of hazardous materials. Preferred Qualifications: Previous experience in a manufacturing or fabrication environment. Certification in TIG welding from a recognized welding organization or institution. Experience with additional welding processes, such as MIG (Metal Inert Gas) or Stick welding. Familiarity with welding automation and robotic welding systems. Join our team and become part of a growing company dedicated to excellence in welding and fabrication. We offer competitive compensation, benefits, and opportunities for professional development and advancement. Apply now to be considered for this exciting opportunity as a TIG Welder!
column11: Tungsten Inert Gas welding, Tig Welding, Welding Engineering
